Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad observation and listing of architectural and sculptural clues with a tentative hypothesis of Dublin.
Divergent exploration of multiple candidate locations (Trinity, Vatican, UN, Washington) with shallow comparisons.

Depth-First.Explanation: Focusing on verifying the Trinity hypothesis by matching specific architectural details.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Match between sphere’s placement outside the Berkeley Library and the Georgian building facade

Depth-First.Explanation: Confirming the specific location on Trinity College campus based on accumulated evidence.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Sphere Within Sphere at Library Square next to Berkeley Library and Museum Building

Depth-First.Explanation: Refining neighborhood designation to meet user’s requirement for a precise neighborhood name.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Choosing between ‘Library Square’ and ‘South-East Inner City’ labels

Depth-First.Explanation: Synthesizing detailed clues and references to finalize the precise location and neighborhood.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Granite paving, overcast climate, and specific campus landmarks (Museum Building and Berkeley Library)

Depth-First.Explanation: Stating the final concise location conclusion.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Final precise designation: Library Square, Trinity College Dublin, South-East Inner City, Dublin 2, Ireland

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Shift from exploring multiple hypotheses broadly to focused verification of the Trinity College hypothesis using detailed clues.
